climbs.name: Ascent up to Asgard
climbs.fa: FA: S. Adamson, I. MacDonald 1986 (5.6 A3).  FFA: J. Adamson, P. Adamson 2018

content.description:
An amazing line up the imposing and impressive overhanging back wall of the Amphitheatre. One of the best and proudest routes of its grade in the province!
The original aid line was done in 2 pitches but the free route should be done as one long pitch. 

Start in a V-shaped chimney (b) to gain a short slab. Pull an interesting and potentially dynamic crux (2b) to gain the wide crack. Up the wide crack and past a large hanging block to the bolted arête leading to ledges and the midway anchor. From the anchor, continue up the corner to a sloping ledge, move slightly left and up to a second ledge (pin). Climb the hollow left-facing corner/flake to the roof (pin, b). Pull the roof and continue up easier terrain to the anchors at the highest point of the amphitheatre. Top out and enjoy the view!

note: there is an old piton at around the height of the 3rd bolt where the original aid line went a bit left. The free version climbs straight up on the bolts.

At the back of the Amphitheatre. The climb starts in a v-shaped chimney with a bolt near its top.
7 bolts, chain anchor. Single rack up to BD #5.

Climb the finger crack in the open book corner directly above pitch one of Bogen. Airy stemming and some fun moves leads to a tree anchor on top.

Big steep corner above Bogen 
Small to medium gear

climbs.name: Centerline
climbs.fa: Pitch 1: Unknown, Pitch 2: Steve Adamson and Julien Marceau, 1983

content.description:
A nice alternative to climbing Jean to access the other routes on the Jean ledge. Fun, easy climbing with loads of gear. A single rack to 3. A 4 would be nice but not necessary. 
Pitch 1: A couple of starts are possible, one just below the Jean start and another further down that is a little more direct. Head straight up to the ledge and belay at a bolted anchor. 
Pitch 2: From the ledge and bolted anchor head straight up through a face with very interesting incut edges. Move up and right at the top of the face and continue up the ridge to a ledge and another bolted anchor.

At the top of the Burrough's approach trail where it connects to the Amphitheater trail. This is the start.
Single rack to 3 or 4 inch piece. Bolted rap stations.

P1: Pull up onto a low ledge. Climb a short wall with several cracks which tops out onto another ledge. This is where the corner truly starts. Layback and stem up the corner, eventually clipping a bolt on the face. Make a few moves left, leaving the corner to get to a small ledge with bolted anchor.
P2: From the small ledge, step left and climb a series of flakes trending up and right, topping out at a tree with chain anchor.

Start from a platform of logs and rocks.
multiples in small sizes.

A variety of features and great position make this route really fun and interesting. 

Climb the first pitch of Jean to get to the Jean ledge. Belay off a bolted anchor on the ledge. From the anchor move up and slightly right to a bolt. After clipping the bolt continue up and then right toward an overhang. Continue moving out right at the overhang and then pull through it when you reach the arete. Clip another bolt on the slab and then continue to the top staying on the arete whenever possible. 
Single rack to #3. Doubles from .5 to 1" would be nice but not absolutely necessary. Rap the route. 2 rappels with a 60 meter rope to get back down to the ground.

Clip a low bolt and pull onto a small slab leading to a corner with a crack/flake. From the top of the flake, clip a second bolt and pull a tricky bulge to gain the arête. Continue up this arête as it turns to slab then kicks back again to steeper angle. Don't let yourself get lured around the corner to the left (Nuclear Fallout). Climb up this steep arête and face, punching for a jug at its top. Easy climbing up and right past some horizontals and ledges takes you to a stance. Launch up and left on the aesthetic and airy final arête to the top. Shares an anchor with Rockstar



This route climbs the arêtes between Rockstar and Nuclear Fallout. Starts on a log and rock platform.

mostly bolted. Bring a .75 or #1 for the flake after 1st bolt and .3-.5 or nuts for an easy section higher up

Start up blocky ramps to gain a stance at the base of a beautiful overhanging crack. Climb this crack to the flake at its top (scary flake moves a bit) then move left to a ledge. Continue up the overhanging corner above the ledge, then traverse right and follow fun features back up and left to a large flake/chimney.

A nice long route with lots of fun climbing!



Near the back of the amphitheatre, just left of the black overhanging alcove.

Standard rack. Rap rings

Steep, sustained climbing on good rock. A tough onsight with challenging gear placements from precarious rests.


This is the first climb up and left of Birdland. Locate a lone bolt about 40 feet off the ground to the right of the 3 bolts found on Wyoming Mustang. 
Single rack to 2". One bolt, bolted rap station. A 70 meter rope works best for this route but you can get off the route in a pinch with a 60 meter.

Fun, easy, jug haul to a nice ledge.  Follow the Burrough's approach trail to where it meets the Amphitheater. Look for a ledge with an big rotten stump on it. This is the start. Move up and a bit right through steep terrain. Follow a natural weakness that leads to an arete. Pull over the arete and onto a slab. Follow the right side of the slab up to a Spruce tree. Step up and left to a ledge and bolted anchor. Belay here.
Pitch 2 - move left on the ledge then up to a right facing corner. Ascend the first block that makes up the corner then bail out left to easy terrain that will take you all the way to the top of the face. Single rack to a 4" piece. Bolted rap stations.

Start in the same spot as Flight of the Valkyries, but after the initial ramps, traverse left over a large questionable block to gain a stance at the base of an overhanging finger crack. Up this to a large ledge. Traverse left along the ledge to the next crack. Up this crack and top out on a second, large slabby ledge with a tree. Stop here or continue to the top of the cliff.

This route has potential to be a 1 or 2 star route but at the time of writing it is extremely dirty and has a lot of loose blocks. 



Start in the same spot as Flight of the Valkyries, but traverse left to the next finger crack. 

Standard rack, doubles in finger sizes. tree anchor

climbs.name: Nuclear Fallout
climbs.fa: FFA: F. Côté, G. Hughes 2019. FA(aid) I. MacDonald, S. Adamson 1984

content.description:
Pull up onto a low ledge. Climb a short wall with several cracks which tops out onto another ledge. This is where the corner truly starts. Layback and stem up the corner, eventually clipping a bolt on the face just before a small roof in the corner which marks the beginning of the crux. Climb the thin corner crack and arête for a few moves before stemming up and left to gain good holds on the left wall. Continue easily up ledges to the final gully leading to the top.

history: originally named Nuclear Holocaust, the name was changed after the free ascent.


locate a platform when hiking up the left side (when looking up towards the back) of the amphitheatre just downhill from Rockstar. The route starts on this platform and climbs a long left-facing corner all the way to the top.
1 bolt, multiples in finger size and smaller. single rack to 3" for the top.

This route is wet much of the season but dries up after an extended period of dry weather.

Climb up surprisingly strenuous moves past 3 bolts then move right to the corner/cave. Use some 3D techniques to make your way up the steep corner to another bolt. Swing climber's right onto a big horn and make a few moves up before returning to the corner and continuing up the overhanging crack, clipping one final bolt and pulling one more crux before the climbing eases up a bit.

Can either be climbed with double ropes to help manage rope drag or a single rope by extending the gear in the corner/cave (I extended with a 120cm sling).



Starts just left of the scary dark maw at the back of the amphitheatre.

Standard rack to BD #3 or #4. Doubles in #2 and doubles in some finger sized gear. Rap Rings.

Developed by Jon and PJ Adamson.

This route climbs a system of corners in the middle of the impressive back wall of the Amphitheatre. Very fun and exposed climbing.

Climb up ramps to the first bolt. Pull over onto a slopey ledge and traverse horizontally right for 3m, passing a few more bolts. Continue straight up into an easy corner (one large cam and one finger sized) and gain a stance at its top. Stem up the next short corner, escaping left under a small roof. Another, harder corner awaits. Navigate this next corner and roof, clipping the long chain along the way and gain a final rest before climbing diagonally up and left on excellent, gently overhanging granite to merge with the top of Odin (small cam behind jug flake).

In order to minimize rope drag, I recommend back-cleaning the first 3 bolts (so as you continue up the route, the first bolt that remains clipped is the 4th).

This could be climbed as sport route but would have a big runout after the 4th bolt and another after the last. 



In the middle of the back wall of the Amphitheatre

a couple small to finger sized cams, one large (#4), 13 bolts, quick clip anchor.

climbs.name: Rockstar
climbs.fa: C. Richardson, T. Adnerson, J. Watts

content.description:
Climb awkward moves up a short corner to gain a left leaning ramp 3m off the ground. Turn a bulge to gain a nice vertical crack in an open book and continue up thin moves to an arete with a series of diagonal cracks with a piton. Follow diagonal cracks left to a ledge, then move right up short chimney with small overhang. Step back left and finish on wall with anchor.

Start 22m uphill into The Amphitheatre directly below a chain anchor at the top, and a piton halfway (keep looking).
Standard rack up to #3 Camalot.

A nice compliment to Gen X. Steep, fun climbing on a variety of features and good rock. Crux is navigating through the roof. Easy if you figure out the beta. Will seem harder if not.


Found on the left side of the Cheekbone formation, just left of Generation X. Look for 3 bolts below a small roof. Climb the face up to the bolts. Pull through the roof then continue up and slightly left to find one more bolt. Continue straight up to a sloping ledge and the anchors. Rap the route or walk off to the left.
Single rack to #2. 4 bolts. Bolted rap station.
Large ampitheatre up from cheekbone corner
